quest_desc.qkname: The One Who Stopped The Doom

talk_paragraph.talk_question: <html>{ui_string:1200001}</html>
<html>{ui_string:1200002}</html>
<html>{ui_string:1200003}</html>
<html>{ui_string:1200004}</html>
<html>{ui_string:1200005}</html>

$Royal Guard Roy$
{user_nick}, Terramai is looking for you.
He said King Cassius has summoned you.

$Elf Elder$
...I have a message from Terramai.
It's about time you returned to the Royal Castle.

$Royal Guard Roy$
It seems like something big is going to happen…
I just hope no harm will go to you, {user_nick}.
Please take care.
(Go to Saint Haven Royal Castle and meet King Cassius)

$Elf Elder$
…If anything happens, I'll go there myself.
Don't worry too much. {user_nick}, you didn't do anything wrong.
So please don't cower in self blame.
(Go to Saint Haven and meet King Cassius)

$Geraint$
Are you done? Don't be distracted!
(Go to Saint Haven Royal Castle)

$Duke Stuart$
…...(His eyes are full of distrust)

$Court Sorceress Kayleen$
….(She looks like she wants to say something but she's holding it back)

$General Douglas$
….(He looks serious)

$Terrence Terramai$
….(He is putting on a warm smile like he's trying to assure you)

${user_nick}$
(The atmosphere is so tense it is suffocating.)

$King Cassius$
Er... erm... ehem... So I got this r-r-report... {user_nick}… It is a p-pity…. Everyone t-tried s-s-so hard… B-but the r-r-results were d-disappointing...
(Cassius carefully checks the expressions on the faces of those around him)

$King Cassius$
(Cassius jolts)H-h-hey... you should at least g-give an e-e-excuse... N-no let me h-hear what happened there...
Won't you t-t-tell me what happened there... What did you s-see…?

${user_nick}$
(The moment I tried to recall what happened, it almost seemed like Argenta's voice was ringing in my ears. Her voice that told me not to make the sad face and told me to be strong as it faded away... It was so stuck in my head that my lips were locked and my voice was muted. Standing there without saying anything sprung murmurs again)

${user_nick}$
(…It was fine when I told the Elder and Yuvenciel what happened. What's wrong with me? As more time passes by, everything I've done seems like a nightmare... The memory of the Ancients... Argenta... Feder... Meriendel... and the discord between the Elves... Ah... everything's a mess... There's no memory that isn't painful... Do I really need to tell them about this?)

$King Cassius$
Erm… {user_nick}?

$Duke Stuart$
(He is clearly being sarcastic)Well well, you were so confident when you first came in here, and now you're scared of taking the responsibility for the defeat? Whatever the case, you're nothing but a half-fledged greenhorn adventurer. This is why I was against trusting young adventurers in the first place.

$Terrence Terramai$
That's too much! How can you say that to someone who just returned from a series of difficult missions? Our friend here has put up a lonely fight at a place where nobody has ever been to and even lost a precious friend! Don't you think a more mature reaction would be to understand what {user_nick} went through?

$Duke Stuart$
Well, Terramai... It's you who has to be understanding of His Majesty's devastation after achieving nothing despite sending so many soldiers. You were the one who said everything's over when the Monolith's doors opened. Yet, this is what we achieved... (Stuart shakes his head)

$Duke Stuart$
The doors of the Monolith have opened and the world will soon end! The royal army couldn't stop it either!
You know this is enough to thrust the people into chaos and instigate a revolt! And it's all because of {user_nick}! Yet, you are not going to make the person who is responsible for all this be held accountable?

$Court Sorceress Kayleen$
I can't stand it anymore. You're sidetracking too much! It was Feder who opened the Monolith, not {user_nick}. Feder is the one who caused all this. {user_nick} asked for our help to stop him but unfortunately, we lost. Putting all the blame on {user_nick} clearly seems like a mistake to me.

$Court Sorceress Kayleen$
Besides, if {user_nick} disappeared in the Monolith, we would have never realised what was happening. We're wasting our precious time here. We should rather devise a plan to catch Feder now.

$Duke Stuart$
That's why we should give duly punishment so that rumours don't spread.
What if...

$Terrence Terramai$
(Terramai quickly interrupts)I totally agree with Kayleen. If you're worried about uprisings, we can stop them. But right now you're trying to imply {user_nick} is going to lead the commoners into a revolt. Don't you agree that this isn't logical, Stuart?

$King Cassius$
(Cassius breaks the tense atmosphere and shouts)Errrrrm...!!!

$Everyone In the Castle$
(All eyes are on Cassius now after hearing his unexpectedly loud attempt to get everyone's attention. While everyone's taken aback, Cassius painfully opens his mouth with everyone focusing on the next word he is going to say)

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>If you've already received the report... then why do you ask again?</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$King Cassius$
Th-there's... s-something weird... I think... It's b-b-been bugging me... since I received the Elf's r-r-report!!! B-b-but {user_nick} who was at the c-center of the b-b-battles is h-here now...!! So let me ask...! Is the Feder you s-s-saw... the l-l-legendary Conqueror Feder?

$King Cassius$
…(He opens his mouth after a few failed attempts to spit the words out)Th-though the k-kingdom is under the Cassius f-f-family now, Feder is... s-s-someone who unified this continent and f-f-founded this kingdom... Why is s-someone like h-h-him trying to o-o-open the M-M-Monolith...? Why is a h-h-hero trying to d-d-destroy this w-w-world...?

$King Cassius$
Why…? How could that be…? The Conqueror King is a hero!! He is… isn't he…?! Though the dynasty has changed, he united the world and was praised and respected by many…! Why would such a king…. C-could it be because… He thought I wasn't doing a good job…? Is that why he escaped the Hero Island…? Tell me!! Now...!! (Cassius is about to burst into tears. No one in the castle dares to say anything)

${user_nick}$
(What should I tell him... Well, he IS the same Feder... But would it be better if I told him that he's not... Or should I explain to him about Feder's intentions...)

${user_nick}$
(...was what I wanted to say, but if the king already received the report... Then maybe it's useless to tell him that. I'm not really keen on telling a lie eiter. I should think about it again.)

${user_nick}$
Feder who tried to open the Monolith… is the same person as the Conqueror King Feder...

$King Cassius$
Wh-what!! Then… He's back because he thinks I'm a lousy king….

${user_nick}$
No, hear me out!
That's not the reason why Feder is trying to open the Monolith and destroy the world!

$King Cassius$
D-do you really mean that?! That why is he doing this…..?

${user_nick}$
That's because… (Wait a second... Do I need to tell him that this world is nothing but a Goddess's dream too? No, I can't tell that to a young king...) Feder is... trying to destroy this world and make a new one.

$King Cassius$
D-destroy this world? He opened the Monolith to destroy this world? Erm... But why...? Why would the Conqueror King want to do that…?

$Duke Stuart$
(Stuart interrupts)Your Majesty, there's no need to delve deeper into the intentions of a villain. He's just a despicable enemy. How dare he try to destroy our world!

$King Cassius$
Erm… Yeah, but…. Still…. He was a hero….

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>(His words are achingly heavy. Who could he be referring to?)</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Terrence Terramai$
A hero in the past may not be a hero in the future. Though he was a hero, maybe he changed his ways or his thoughts became so twisted that he thinks what he's doing is for the good, like he always did….(Terramai somehow looks lonely)

$King Cassius$
Is that right…?(Cassius seems disappointed)

$Duke Stuart$
(Stuart cuts in abruptly)This is not a time for such useless discussions... This is not a time for us to be concerned about his identity. Since we keep sidetracking, I would like to suggest adjourning this meeting. Let's cool our heads for a while.

$Duke Stuart$
And {user_nick}? See me. I have something to check with you.
(Stuart glares this way with a vicious look in his eyes. Go and talk to Stuart.)

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>What is it that you want to check...?</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Duke Stuart$
…Ah that stupid old man... Can't he just use his brain and think where the conversation is heading?! He's making it plain that he has no experience whatsoever in dealing with kids!! The king's young!! He should take that into account. Why is he saying such things in front of the young king?(Stuart is mumbling to himself like he's flustered)

$Duke Stuart$
…Maybe the Goddess is helping you afterall. By right, I was planning to throw you into the prison. But looking at how things are going, it would be much more beneficial to make you work for me than rot in a dark cell.

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>I will not run away from my responsibilities.</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Duke Stuart$
…You seem to have become conceited after gaining so much trust from Terramai. But don't forget -- you have a responsibility. Though you may manage to escape going to a prison this time, your responsibility doesn't dissipate into the air. Got that? I'm sure you also have some common sense and didn't expect things to end here.

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>What kind of mission will I be on?</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Duke Stuart$
Yeah, you should take your responsibility. So you can't complain even if you are tasked with the toughest mission to pay for this incident. Got that?

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>If it's agreed by everyone, I will follow.</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Duke Stuart$
I asked first.

$Duke Stuart$
Good. I was expecting to hear that. Now go on. The meeting will resume soon.
(Stuart lets out a sigh of relief. Since the break is over, talk to Cassius)

$King Cassius$
….L-let's continue.
Our i-initial g-g-goal was... to f-find someone to be held r-r-responsible for the war...?

$Duke Stuart$
That's right, Your Majesty. Let me summarise it for you. Like we have discussed just now, it would be unfair to make {user_nick} bear all the responsibility. Also, we need to think about the future. We need to track Feder down. (Kayleen turns to Stuart like she's surprised)

$Duke Stuart$
But {user_nick} is the one who led us into this and should take some kind of responsibility though. So my suggestion is... Why not send {user_nick} to track Feder down, ALONE? Without any royal soldiers involved this time.

$Terrence Terramai$
Oh Stuart, do you think you make any sense right now? You're trying to make {user_nick} search the entire continent all alone?

$Duke Stuart$
Oh there's something I missed out. There's a particular place that {user_nick} would be in charge of. Like the area around Feder's old palace for example.

$General Douglas$
Feder's old palace? That's the place where it was thought to be the base of the Dragon Followers... Our soldiers were annihilated by unknown creatures when they were sent there for an investigation...

$Duke Stuart$
Yes, that's right. But it's an area worth investigating, and we need to save up on men. It would be a good idea to send {user_nick} alone. {user_nick} is strong and brave enough to have fought with Feder in the Monolith. {user_nick} would be fulfilling own responsibilities too.

$Terrence Terramai$
But {user_nick} must be exhausted after all that has happened. Do you think fighting face-to-face with Feder is something easy? I'm against this. Send someone who just returned from hell back to hell? That's not the right thing to do.

$Duke Stuart$
Let's ask {user_nick}. What do you think?
This is the best way to make up for what you did and track Feder down at the same time.

${user_nick}$
…(Feder's old palace...? Would Feder really be there? Even if it's a dangerous place where many lives were lost, I can't waste time hesitating if I can get at least a small clue about Feder there...)

${user_nick}$
I'll go. I've recovered while I was in the land of the Elves so I'm fine.

$Terrence Terramai$
…Hey…!!!

$Court Sorceress Kayleen$
….(She frowns and mumbles to herself like she's unhappy with what's going on)You don't look fine at all...

$Duke Stuart$
Great. Have we reached a decision then? Now, shall we discuss about the rewards for achievements?
Chasing Feder away by earning the cooperation of the Elves was a great achievement that future kings should know about. (Stuart looks highly satisfied)

$Duke Stuart$
{user_nick} stands at the center of that achievement, but our soldiers did most work. It was also an opportunity we proved our strength to a foreign land of the Elves. Though {user_nick} was the one who fought Feder, our soldiers should get the recognition for their outstanding achievements.

${user_nick}$
…Wait, I didn't achieve anything. It was Argenta who did everything. It was Argenta who fought Feder, not me...!!

$Duke Stuart$
Argenta...? Someone with the same name as the silver-haired swordswoman who travelled with the Six Heroes 50 years ago... I thought Geraint or Velskud were popular names, but I didn't expect that name to be used so commonly nowadays too. I'm sorry, it would be hard to recognise the achievements of a nameless swordsman who's not registered with the Royal Guards.

${user_nick}$
Wh-what...??? Argenta fought with her life to stop Feder!! How can you say that!!!!

$Terrence Terramai$
Stuart, that's enough. We know achievements and rewards are important, but it's not right to rush those matters right now without full information.(Terramai hurriedly stops him, but with a forceful voice)

$Duke Stuart$
…(He frowns like he's unhappy)It's not right? Tsk tsk... You shouldn't take every word of that young adventurer seriously... Anyways... Let's discuss this among ourselves later.

$Court Sorceress Kayleen$
Discussing among "ourselves" shouldn't become another monologue of yours, Stuart. Let's call it a day. {user_nick}, come. I have some information to pass to you for your mission. (The meeting has ended... Go to Kayleen)

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html><FONT color=#2b2723>(I'm so choked with emotions that I can't even swear properly.)</FONT></html>
<html>He doesn't even know how Argenta felt when she fought Feder...!!</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Court Sorceress Kayleen$
(Kayleen mumbles a spell below her breath, breathes in deeply, then starts shouting vulgarities)
AHHH!!! That $%^(*#$^!! He didn't even lift a finger when my sorceresses were dying in battle, and here he is spouting those nonsense! Argh!! You can swear all you want too!! I chanted a spell so that they can't hear us right now.

$Court Sorceress Kayleen$
It's only natural that you're angry. I mean, can anyone stay calm in that kind of situation? Huh?? Phew... To think that such a jerk is in charge of educating the king... I should have been the one to take that position. Then all this wouldn't have happened.(Kayleen shakes her head)

$Court Sorceress Kayleen$
…And you. You don't have to be so down. You're not the one who hurt your friend….
But I guess whatever I say won't make you feel much better. You're still young so you can think about what to do a little more. Not everyone here are obnoxious blockheads. (Kayleen tries to comfort you)

$General Douglas$
If you're talking about the mission, may I interrupt? You probably need the map from us.
(Kayleen quickly takes the map, ignoring Douglas's curiosity on the previous conversation between you and Kayleen)

$General Douglas$
Hmm well... Let me explain about this map. All the paths we took were dangerous, so... I recommend this path through Anu Arendel. It's called the "Forest of Little Shadows". You are on good terms with the Elves so I guess it would be a good idea to take this route. By the way....(Douglas reaches his hand out for a handshake and your reflexes make you grab his hand automatically)

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>It's not something you should apologize about...</html>
<html>It's not me who should get an apology... it's Argenta.</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$General Douglas$
I know Stuart was rather harsh just now. Let me apologize on his behalf. He always thinks of what is best for the royal family... There's nothing more painful than seeing your comrade's achievements being disregarded. Let me apologise once again.

$General Douglas$
But please, take my sincere apologies. That's all I can do for now. Your friend Argenta has done something outstanding. No matter what others say, her achievements cannot be denied. She saved the world. You can be proud of that anywhere you go.

${user_nick}$
…….

$General Douglas$
And we will carry on with what she sought to do by risking her own life. Even if Feder was a Conqueror King in the past, we will not stand around and see him ruin our homeland. It's a pity that her remains couldn't be retrieved... But I swear, by my position as the General, that I will not forget what she did for us.

$Court Sorceress Kayleen$
Same for me. Giving her a medal of honour is the least we can do for injuring Feder. Stuart is just... (Kayleen shakes her head)We won't take this lying down so don't worry. We have to recognise what has to be recognised!! I promise, by the name of Fairystar.

$General Douglas$
Terramai will give you the royal letter for your mission.
We will start investigating as soon as our losses have been recovered too.
(Douglas seems to be feeling really sorry. Go to Terramai)

$Terrence Terramai$
(He opens his mouth as soon as you approach him as if he was worried)
Why can't you just tell them about your achievements? This is a very dangerous mission. Stuart has been harping on responsibilities, but we wouldn't have been able to go to Anu Arendel if it was not for you! We could have just faced the end of the world without knowing anything!!

$Terrence Terramai$
Ah…(Terramai seems to be having a hard time trying to find the right words to say)
You've done so much for us that I've been forgetting how young you are... But what you did is definitely commendable. What you've done until now, and what you've done for this incident as well... I suggest holding another meeting for...

${user_nick}$
…No, I'll go. I have Geraint with me, and it's true that we don't have much time…
Though I didn't do much, I'm not weak….

$Terrence Terramai$
….(Terramai stares at you for a while and sighs)
Though I serve the Goddess, I feel like blaming her at times like this. How much ordeal would there be in the path of this young adventurer... They say the Goddess gives ordeals just so much that one can endure, but this... this is too much….

$Terrence Terramai$
…I'm sure Argenta wouldn't want you to get hurt either.
So... Don't blame yourself too much.
(Terramai hands over the royal letter. Take it to Elf Elder)

$Geraint$
Are you done? Can you just focus on your task? Hurry up!
(Go to Elf Elder)

$Elf Elder$
Ah, {user_nick}. You're back. How did things go?
(Explain what happened in the castle as you give him the royal letter)

$Elf Elder$
(Hints of fury appear on Elf Elder's face) Is that how humans treat a hero?! ...Anyway, we should follow what they say for now. Can I see the map please? Hmm... if he told you to go through Anu Arendel... Oh, this looks like the route created by Sage Meriendel.

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>(Is she nothing but a traitor to the Elves...?)</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Elf Elder$
She's a legendary Elf who is said to be the wisest Elf that ever lived. But she joined Feder and disappeared later in her life… (Elf Elder keeps it short) Anyway, the Forest of Little Shadows is near the Forest of Shady Blue Moon. It's likely of her to have created a route that leads to Feder's palace.

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>He didn't create any trouble, did he?</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Elf Elder$
Please go with Geraint.
He has been waiting for you for a long time.

$Elf Elder$
…(Elf Elder smiles)Of course not. He has been very quiet as usual. Though he is not very familiar with this world yet because he's still young, he still is a dragon. (The Elder is being conned, but I have no energy to argue with him. Go and look for Geraint.)

$Geraint$
Why are you here only now?
<html>$Quest Reward$</html>

$Geraint$
…You're always late!
(Geraint looks at you with a sulky face)

journal.title: The One Who Stopped The Doom 1
journal.contents:
It's time to report on the fierce battle at the Monolith.
Go to Saint Haven Royal Castle.

Saint Haven - Saint Haven Royal Castle
journal.todo_msg: Quest has been added. Go to Saint Haven Royal Castle.

journal.title: The One Who Stopped The Doom 2
journal.contents:
Cassius has something to say...?! Listen to Cassius.

Saint Haven - Saint Haven Royal Castle (King Cassius)
journal.todo_msg: Cassius is trying to say something. Listen to him.

journal.title: The One Who Stopped The Doom 3
journal.contents:
Stuart seems to have something to say. Listen to Stuart.

Saint Haven - Saint Haven Royal Castle (Duke Stuart)

journal.title: The One Who Stopped The Doom 4
journal.contents:
Stuart seems to be trying to give you a special mission.
Though you're not exactly sure what the mission would be, the meeting is about to start so go and talk to King Cassius.

Saint Haven - Saint Haven Royal Castle (King Cassius)

journal.title: The One Who Stopped The Doom 5
journal.contents:
You were tasked to investigate a particularly dangerous area alone to track Feder down.
Kayleen says she'll give you a map, so go and talk to her.

Saint Haven - Saint Haven Royal Castle (Court Sorceress Kayleen)

journal.title: The One Who Stopped The Doom 6
journal.contents:
You've received the map from Kayleen. General Douglas apologized on Stuart's behalf for ignoring Argenta's achievements... Terramai will give you the royal letter so go and talk to him.

Saint Haven - Saint Haven Royal Castle (Terrence Terramai)
journal.todo_msg: Get the royal letter from Terrence Terramai.

journal.title: The One Who Stopped The Doom 7
journal.contents:
Deliver the royal letter to Elf Elder.

Anu Arendel (Tree of Life Entrance) - Elf Elder
journal.todo_msg: Deliver the royal letter to Elf Elder.

journal.title: The One Who Stopped The Doom 8
journal.contents:
You have delivered the royal letter to Elf Elder.
Geraint is waiting for you so go and look for him.

Anu Arendel - Geraint
